alert.note: Alert for Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:27PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Yellowstone County through 800 PM MDT... At 726 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Billings West End, or 7 miles southwest of Billings. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Billings, Laurel and Billings West End. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Motorists should prepare for rapidly changing conditions. Localized flooding of low-lying areas and roadways is possible. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
